intro: Merianthera parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved merianthera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs. Merianthera parvifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
